meanings.definition: In a timely manner; at the appropriate time.
meanings.sent1: She arrived seasonably for the meeting, just in time to hear the important announcement.
meanings.sent2: The train departed seasonably, ensuring all passengers reached their destinations on schedule.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seasonably gathered nuts for the winter, showing impressive time management skills.
meanings.sent4: The flowers bloomed seasonably, painting the garden with vibrant colors at the perfect moment.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock rang seasonably, waking her up right when she needed to start her day.

meanings.definition: In accordance with the season; suitable for the time of year.
meanings.sent1: She wore a seasonably light dress to the summer picnic, staying cool in the warm weather.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant served seasonably fresh vegetables, sourced locally to match the current season.
meanings.sent3: The snowman looked seasonably out of place in the middle of summer, causing laughter among the beachgoers.
meanings.sent4: His jokes were seasonably appropriate for the holiday party, adding a festive touch to the gathering.
meanings.sent5: The cozy fireplace made the room feel seasonably warm, creating a comfortable atmosphere for the guests.
